meanings.definition: Youks (verb): to make a sudden, sharp movement
meanings.sent1: She youksed when the door slammed shut.
meanings.sent2: The cat youksed away when it saw the dog.
meanings.sent3: The clown youksed comically across the stage.
meanings.sent4: The lightning youksed through the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The sudden youks of the car brakes startled me.

meanings.definition: Youks (noun): a sudden, sharp movement or sound
meanings.sent1: I heard a youks in the bushes and got scared.
meanings.sent2: The youks of the falling vase echoed in the room.
meanings.sent3: The youks of the jumping frog made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The youks of the roller coaster ride thrilled me.
meanings.sent5: The youks of the falling tree branches startled the birds.
